Subjective: Fatigue x2 months; morning stiffness; muscle pain; back pain; superficial sleep. No fever, weight loss, night sweats, snoring, chest pain, palpitations, or joint pain. Works full-time; climbs 2-3x/week. Concern: Possible rheumatism. Request: Blood tests for anemia, thyroid, inflammation.
Objective: BP 110/60; HR 40-60. Lungs clear; heart normal. Back: mild tenderness lower spine. Abdomen soft, non-tender; active bowel sounds.
Assessment: Fatigue of unclear etiology. Consider anemia, thyroid dysfunction, or inflammatory process. No evidence of rheumatoid arthritis or cardiac/lung issues.
Plan: Order blood tests: CBC, TSH, CRP, ESR.
Patient to schedule phone follow-up post-results.
Advise to continue usual activities and monitor symptoms.
Safety net: Seek urgent care if chest pain, SOB, or severe fatigue.
